page.title: 16THE DALES NATIONAL PARK
page.content: The Yorkshire Dales National Park was established in 1974. The National Park is neither nationally-owned, nor a 'park' in the usual sense of the word. Its aim is to conserve the beauty of the area and at the same time to provide opportunities for everyone to enjoy it. This is achieved by imposing strict planning regulations on all building and development and providing an advisory service on land use and ecology to all who live in, work in or visit the area. One of the two main administrative offices is alongside the Ure at Yorebridge with a staff of 22 and one warden covering Wensleydale. The sign of the Dales National Park is a Swaledale ram's head.
